terms.definition: A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions if needed.
Application Programming Interface - a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate and share data with each other.
A single, unified storage location where all documents, files, and data are stored and managed, providing a single source of truth for teams.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted online and accessed through web browsers rather than installed locally.
The use of technology to automatically execute business processes and tasks without manual intervention, improving efficiency and reducing errors.
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document or project simultaneously, with changes visible instantly to all participants.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, used for compliance and accountability purposes.
A security system that grants or restricts user access to features and content based on their assigned role or position within an organization.
Pre-designed document formats that provide standardized structure and formatting for consistent documentation creation across teams.
A centralized location where all authoritative and up-to-date information is stored, ensuring everyone accesses the same accurate data.
Formal records and reports required to demonstrate adherence to industry regulations, standards, and legal requirements.
The process of distributing information, expertise, and best practices among team members and across an organization.
The process of searching for and accessing specific documents or information from a storage system or database.
A chronological log of all changes made to a document, including who made changes, when they were made, and what was modified.
The process of connecting different software systems or applications so they can work together and share data seamlessly.
